column1: Bosscat Kitchen & Libations////Good service abounds here and I will no doubt return but my first visit was less than stellar. The pork sandwich just felt like it was in need of tweaking. In a word
column2: unremarkable. Just lacking a bite of something tart
column4: or sour just to set off the savory only sandwich. The waitress brought out some BBQ mayonnaise which brought it more to life. The sweet potato mac and cheese
column5: if I had taken it home
column6: would have been subjected to a redo complete with maple bacon chips
column7: blue cheese and some lightly saut√©ed onions . Again just shy of wonderful. Drink was spot on with a generous pour
column8: and the chicken flatbread was flawless. I don't mind spending $60 on myself once in a great while when the fare is more than fair so next time I'll bring the hot sauce.
